alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 8:09PM EST until December 24 at 8:13AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Westham affecting Henrico, Chesterfield and City of Richmond Counties. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Richmond Westham, Cartersville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River At Richmond Westham. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding along both banks, no damage at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight to a crest of 12.1 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage by mid to late Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 09/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning by 815 AM EST.
